subject: Languages
title: Hildegard of Bingen's Secret Language
description: One-minute skill: Hildegard of Bingen's Secret Language.

hook.text: In the 1100s, a German nun created the earliest known constructed language â€” for mystical purposes.

buildup.text: Hildegard of Bingen invented 'Lingua Ignota' with over 1,000 words and its own alphabet.

discovery.text: The language mixed Latin, German, and invented roots. Its purpose remains a mystery.

twist.text: Some scholars think it was a mystical language for communicating with the divine.

climax.text: Hildegard's creation proves that the urge to invent languages is nearly a thousand years old.

punchline.text: The first conlang was built by a nun who wanted to talk to God in her own words.

quiz.question: Who created the earliest known constructed language?
